The answer is both. Here’s how you can do it. Here, let's dive into six tips to ensure you don't have to sacrifice your own creative freedom for the sake of organic growth. Read this post By: Rand Fishkin February 2, 2018 What Does It Mean to "Write for SEO" in 2018? Content Marketing | Whiteboard Friday | SEO Copywriting Writers regularly receive dangerously incorrect advice on how to write for SEO. To protect your site from Google penalties and ensure your writing is appropriate for modern SEO standards, Rand outlines outdated practices and a brief 5-step writing process for 2018. Read this post By: Rand Fishkin October 13, 2017 Writing Headlines that Serve SEO, Social Media, and Website Visitors All Together SEO Copywriting | Whiteboard Friday | Content Marketing A single headline can't do it all. You need to develop something a little different for your goals tied to SEO, social media, and site visitors. This Whiteboard Friday covers a process to help optimize your titles across multiple platforms. Read this post By: Ian Lurie August 4, 2017 Writing with Markdown for Better Content & HTML: Why & How To Content Marketing | Whiteboard Friday | SEO Copywriting The one great tragedy of content creation is HTML. Cut out the cruddy code produced from writing in word processors by adopting Markup and text editors as your go-to writing solution. Read this post By: Britney Muller July 26, 2017 The Lazy Writer’s Guide to 30-Minute Keyword Research Keyword Research | Content Marketing | SEO Copywriting Keyword research doesn’t have to be a marathon bender. A brisk 30-minute walk can provide incredible insights — insights that connect you with a wider audience on a deeper level. Read this post By: Ronell Smith July 4, 2017 6 Tips to Make Your Brand an Email Response Rockstar Email Marketing | Content Marketing | SEO Copywriting Are you ready to create emails that get replies? It's time to step away from the clickbait-y subject lines hawking insincere or insignificant promises, and instead deliver messages worthy of earning a response. Read this post By: Isla McKetta July 14, 2016 Storytelling 301: Site Content as Story Content Marketing | SEO Copywriting "Storytelling" can be more than just jargon. This post will show you six types of stories you can inject into your site content to develop a compelling, powerful brand story. Read this post By: Khalid Saleh May 31, 2016 4 Ways Copywriting Can Boost Your E-commerce Conversion Rates Conversion Rate Optimization (CRO) | E-Commerce SEO | SEO Copywriting Make your copy work more effectively for your e-commerce brand by matching the language to the intended audience. Read this post By: Isla McKetta May 25, 2016 Is Your Writing Readable? 3 Concepts to Master for Copy That Converts Content Marketing | User Experience (UX) | SEO Copywriting Chunking, word recognition, and universal design are the cornerstones of readable copy. Are you writing in a way your audience can easily understand? In this post, Isla McKetta doles out the top insights from her research into readability and its utter importance. Read this post By: Rand Fishkin April 12, 2016 Great Content ≠ Long-Form Content Content Marketing | Marketing Psychology | SEO Copywriting "Great" content and long-form content are not the same thing. In this post, Rand explains the difference, the reasons for the correlations, and an alternative path to making content that accomplishes your goals and those of your audience. Or even the first few words? I would venture to bet the answer is "not often."In fact, I find that the books which turn out to be my favorite in the end typically take at least 50-100 pages to “pick up pace.” But we expect that when we read a good book.
